briefTitle: Efficacy Study of Activated Prothrombin Complex for Prevention of Bleeds in Hemophilia A With Inhibitors
officialTitle: A Prospective, Randomized, Cross-over Study of an Activated Prothrombin Complex Concentrate for Secondary Prophylaxis in Patients With Hemophilia A and Inhibitors
summary: The objective of this study is to assess whether prophylactic therapy with an activated prothrombin complex concentrate (FEIBA)will result in a significant reduction in the number of bleeds in patients with hemophilia and persistent high responding inhibitors.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Bleeds During 6 Month Treatment Period
